title: Priyanka Bose's Oscars 2017 Red Carpet Dress Was as Sustainable as It Was Chic - Vogue
text: Priyanka Bose’s Oscars Dress Was as Sustainable as It Was Chic February 27, 2017 10:47 PM by Maria Ward 1 / 9 My first fitting with Red Carpet Green Dress founder Suzy Amis Cameron—she is so inspirational. Photo: Courtesy of Priyanka Bose For her first appearance at the Academy Awards , the Indian actress Priyanka Bose dazzled in a Vivienne Westwood couture dress that was both chic and sustainable. The recycled gown, embellished with a metallic floral motif, was made with archival fabric from a previous collection. Every step of the design process was tailored for this special occasion in collaboration with Suzy Amis Cameron, the founder of Red Carpet Green Dress, a contest that challenges designers to create eco-friendly fashions suitable for the red carpet. In the final hours leading up to the Academy Awards, it was all about putting the finishing touches to make the beautiful dress into an unforgettable look. Enter Bose’s glamour team: With Steven Mason manning hair and Nick Barose on makeup duty, Bose was fully covered from a beauty perspective. For an up-close look at how the eco-friendly fashion moment came to fruition, starting with the preliminary sketch leading up to the final adjustments, Bose shared candid photos that chronicle her Oscars debut, as seen in the slideshow above.
